availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Albert G. Jefferson (Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Sarah Elizabeth Graves Jefferson in Sumner County, Tennessee, on December 13, 1830. Father of Peterfield Jefferson, John J. Jefferson, Sarah C. Jefferson, Virginia E. Jefferson, Martha M. Jefferson, Ada Jefferson, Thomas Jefferson, and George H. Jefferson. Farmer in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Trigg County in 1860. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, p. 359A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, p. 287.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 111.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 43B.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Sumner County, 1787 - 1838: Marriages, p. 178.
David Sumner, Kim Fortner, Pam Metts, and Charles Morris, Cemeteries of Cadiz and Trigg County, Kentucky (Sumforme Publishing, 2008), 191.
